intro: Tetranthera nervosa var. coriacea, commonly known as the rough-stemmed tetranthera, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems that are covered with a rough, woody texture. The leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. This plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
